title: Bunyip
data:

|   | A flesh-eating beast that uses its five long limbs interchangeably. It moves with alarming speed, but must pause to reorganize itself after each attack. Its distinctive screams carry far and wide. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [5 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Bunyips** are fast-moving, slow-attacking monsters found in [the Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp"). While they can do gruesome damage in melee, they must rest for around 2 turns after each set of attacks.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                           |                                                                                                         |
| :---------- | ----------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Warning Cry](/Warning_Cry "Warning Cry") | [Vocal flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), [Breath flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- A very dangerous enemy. With a maximum of 120 damage, bunyips can one-shot many characters entering Swamp. Avoiding them is tricky; the watery terrain makes it difficult for any non-[Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk") to escape.

  - [Flight](/Flight "Flight") and a [potion of haste](/Potion_of_haste "Potion of haste") allow most species to move at the same speed as a bunyip. [Passage of Golubria](/Passage_of_Golubria "Passage of Golubria") (or a [scroll of blinking](/Scroll_of_blinking "Scroll of blinking"), in an emergency) can give you some space.
  - Think of bunyips as good practice for fighting any [juggernauts](/Juggernaut "Juggernaut") you might see later on -- they share the same speed and attack mechanics, and even the same maximum damage.

- Due to their exceptionally slow attack speed, bunyips often won't follow or attack you if you take some stairs to a different floor.

- Bunyips have only moderate [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") for this stage of the game. [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") or hex [wands](/Wand "Wand") can prove useful, and a [scroll of fear](/Scroll_of_fear "Scroll of fear") is likely to work. Unfortunately, their resistance to [poison](/Poison "Poison") makes [curare](/Curare "Curare") [darts](/Dart "Dart") ineffective.

- You can use [Fulminant Prism](/Fulminant_Prism "Fulminant Prism") or [Summoning](/Summoning "Summoning") spells in order to force the bunyip to attack, causing it to waste turns. This can be combined with damage over time effects like [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud") or a [wand of roots](/Wand_of_roots "Wand of roots") to kill it from a distance.

## Trivia

[Bunyips](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bunyip) are creatures from Australian Aboriginal mythology.

## History

Bunyips were added in [0.26](/0.26 "0.26").
html:
Bunyip

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
bunyip x 
HP 52-107
HD 12
XP 1233
Speed 15 (Atk: 450%)
AC 6
EV 10
Will 60
Attack1 40 (claw: plain)
Attack2 40 (claw: plain)
Attack3 40 (claw: plain)
Resistances rPois+
rDrown
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Amphibious
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Large
Type bunyip, bunyip
Flags Warm-blooded
A flesh-eating beast that uses its five long limbs interchangeably. It moves with alarming speed, but must pause to reorganize itself after each attack. Its distinctive screams carry far and wide.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 Trivia
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Bunyips are fast-moving, slow-attacking monsters found in the Swamp. While they can do gruesome damage in melee, they must rest for around 2 turns after each set of attacks.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Warning Cry Vocal flag,
Breath flag

Tips & Tricks

  • A very dangerous enemy. With a maximum of 120 damage, bunyips can one-shot many characters entering Swamp. Avoiding them is tricky; the watery terrain makes it difficult for any non-Merfolk to escape.
    • Flight and a potion of haste allow most species to move at the same speed as a bunyip. Passage of Golubria (or a scroll of blinking, in an emergency) can give you some space.
    • Think of bunyips as good practice for fighting any juggernauts you might see later on -- they share the same speed and attack mechanics, and even the same maximum damage.
  • Due to their exceptionally slow attack speed, bunyips often won't follow or attack you if you take some stairs to a different floor.
  • Bunyips have only moderate willpower for this stage of the game. Hexes or hex wands can prove useful, and a scroll of fear is likely to work. Unfortunately, their resistance to poison makes curare darts ineffective.
  • You can use Fulminant Prism or Summoning spells in order to force the bunyip to attack, causing it to waste turns. This can be combined with damage over time effects like Freezing Cloud or a wand of roots to kill it from a distance.

Trivia

Bunyips are creatures from Australian Aboriginal mythology.

History

Bunyips were added in 0.26.

Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Bunyip&oldid=72617"

rawPage:
{{version030}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Bunyips''' are fast-moving, slow-attacking monsters found in [[the Swamp]]. While they can do gruesome damage in melee, they must rest for around 2 turns after each set of attacks.

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*A very dangerous enemy. With a maximum of 120 damage, bunyips can one-shot many characters entering Swamp. Avoiding them is tricky; the watery terrain makes it difficult for any non-[[Merfolk]] to escape. 
**[[Flight]] and a [[potion of haste]] allow most species to move at the same speed as a bunyip. [[Passage of Golubria]] (or a [[scroll of blinking]], in an emergency) can give you some space.
**Think of bunyips as good practice for fighting any [[juggernaut]]s you might see later on -- they share the same speed and attack mechanics, and even the same maximum damage.
*Due to their exceptionally slow attack speed, bunyips often won't follow or attack you if you take some stairs to a different floor.
*Bunyips have only moderate [[willpower]] for this stage of the game. [[Hexes]] or hex [[wand]]s can prove useful, and a [[scroll of fear]] is likely to work. Unfortunately, their resistance to [[poison]] makes [[curare]] [[dart]]s ineffective.
*You can use [[Fulminant Prism]] or [[Summoning]] spells in order to force the bunyip to attack, causing it to waste turns. This can be combined with damage over time effects like [[Freezing Cloud]] or a [[wand of roots]] to kill it from a distance.

==Trivia==
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bunyip Bunyips] are creatures from Australian Aboriginal mythology.

==History==
Bunyips were added in [[0.26]].
